contentrichtext.text: {{Multiple issues |primary sources = August 2011 |orphan = March 2011 |self-published = August 2011 }} '''Eldis''' is a [[database]] and email service of [[information source]]s on [[international development]]. It aims to share the best knowledge on development, policy, practice and research. == Background == "Eldis" was originally an acronym for "Electronic Development and Environment Information System". It is one of a family of knowledge services produced at the [[Institute of Development Studies]], [[Sussex]], England. == Funding == Eldis is funded by the UK [[Department for International Development]] (DFID), [[Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency]] (Sida), the [http://www.norad.no/ Norwegian Agency for Development Cooperation (Norad)] and the [http://www.deza.ch Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC)]. == Database == The information on Eldis is organised into a number of subject-focused "resource guides" and regional and country "profiles" ==References== {{reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.eldis.org/ Eldis web site.] * [http://community.eldis.org/ Eldis community site and social network.] * [http://idv.sagepub.com/cgi/content/abstract/12/3/155] - ELDIS: mapping information on development and the environment.] === Eldis resource guides === *
